content.description:
Iuvenes, mane surgite et ad urbem magna celeritateÂ 
iter facite.
content.question: How is the sentence translated?

choices.label: The young men will rise early and will make the big journey from the city with great speed.
Young men, rise early to make the journey from the city as quickly as possible.
The young men rise early and make the journey with speed to the big city.
Young men, rise early and make the journey to the city with great speed.

content.answer: Young men, rise early and make the journey to the city with great speed.
